events.message: Customer reported a car collision that happened on the morning of June 1st involving their vehicle at a city intersection.
The claim has been categorized under Auto Accident after reviewing the initial damage description and keywords.
Assigned a claims agent who specializes in vehicle accident cases to manage the investigation and communication.
Sent confirmation email to customer acknowledging receipt of their auto accident claim and outlining next steps.
Requested relevant documents from the customer including police report, photos of the damaged vehicle, and repair estimates.
Received all required documents from the customer promptly, including the official police report and detailed repair invoices.
Investigation has been initiated by the claims agent to verify facts, assess damage extent, and gather additional evidence if needed.
Completed in-depth investigation including inspection of the vehicle damage and review of the incident circumstances.
Proposed a fair settlement amount to the customer based on the assessment report and repair cost estimates.
Customer expressed satisfaction with the proposed settlement and willingness to proceed with the claim resolution.
Claim has been officially approved by the claims department, authorizing payment to cover the damages.
Issued payment to the customerâ€™s preferred bank account covering the agreed settlement amount for the auto damage.
Closed the auto accident claim file after confirming receipt of payment and finalizing all related documentation.
The claim documents and records have been archived successfully for future reference and regulatory compliance.
